Package game

Class Chessboard

java.lang.Object
game.Chessboard
All Implemented Interfaces:
ChessboardUI
public class Chessboard extends Object implements ChessboardUI
Chessboard implementation. Holds onto a list of Tiles that represent the tiles in the 8x8 board. These tiles hold onto the pieces that occupy them. Draws itself by iterating through this list and calling their draw methods. Has a multitude of methods for different kinds of moves, standard and special cases, and determining end game conditions.
Author:
Jonathan Houge & Julius Ramirez & Khojiakbar Yokubjonov

      An array containing Strings which represent the order of the horizontal coordinates

    • promotion

      private boolean promotion
      A boolean which represents if this Chessboard object has made a promotion move. If set to true, it gets handled by the server so the opponent doesn't pick the promotion piece, and is then promptly set to false.

    • selectedCoordinates

      private List<Coordinate> selectedCoordinates
      A List of Coordinate objects which represent the tiles the selected piece can move to. It's worth noting that the selected piece Piece object is not actually saved however.

  • Constructor Details

    • Chessboard

      public Chessboard(org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Canvas canvas, org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Shell shell, org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display display)
      Chessboard constructor. Takes in the needed SWT assets for everything that needs to be done. Utilizes the display to get the color needed for outlining and the font needed for the board coordinates.
      Parameters:
      shell - : UI's shell.
      display - : UI's display

  • Method Details

    • createBoardData

      public void createBoardData(org.eclipse.swt.graphics.GC gc)
      Creation method, only ran once for initialization. Makes an empty board, creating the tiles themselves by utilizing the Tile class.
      Specified by:
      createBoardData in interface ChessboardUI
      Parameters:
      gc - : event gc, let's us draw on the canvas

    • setAllPieces

      public void setAllPieces()
      Adds all the chess pieces to the board. Used for the new game only.

    • makePiece

      private Piece makePiece(int x, int y)
      Helper function responsible for making the pieces and putting them in their starting positions.
      Parameters:
      x - : row in board
      y - : column in board
      Returns:
      Piece that was made

    • draw

      public void draw(org.eclipse.swt.graphics.GC gc)
      The for loop to draw the board. The helper function 'Drawing' holds onto all of the conditionals needed in the process.
      Specified by:
      draw in interface ChessboardUI
      Parameters:
      x - : row in board
      y - : column in board
      gc - : event gc, let's us draw on the canvas

    • drawing

      private void drawing(int x, int y, org.eclipse.swt.graphics.GC gc)
      The helper function 'Drawing'. Need to make sure that tiles are drawn the right color: if a piece is currently selected the tile is green, a tile is cyan if it's a valid place for the currently selected piece to move, and if neither of these are true, the original color stands. Also adds the board coordinates on the side (A-H, 1-8).
      Parameters:
      x - : row in board
      y - : column in board
      gc - : event gc, let's us draw on the canvas

    • addBoardCoords

      private void addBoardCoords(org.eclipse.swt.graphics.GC gc, int x, int y)
      The helper function of 'Drawing'. Makes sure the board coordinates of A-H and 1-8 are drawn in the appropriate locations.
      Parameters:
      x - : row in board
      y - : column in board
      gc - : event gc, let's us draw on the canvas

    • getBoardIndex

      public int[] getBoardIndex(float x, float y)
      Accepts the pixel coordinates, converts them to a valid index on the board, and returns an array containing those coordinates.
      Parameters:
      x - a float that represents the y coordinate on the canvas where the user clicked.
      y - a float that represents the y coordinate on the canvas where the user clicked.
      Returns:
      an Integer array of length two where index 0 is x and index 1 is the y board coordinate.

    • getBoard

      public Tile[][] getBoard()
      Board getter, returns the board.
      Returns:
      board: the list of tiles that make up the board.

    • getKing

      public King getKing(boolean getWhite)
      This method returns a specific colored king piece so that it may be used for check and checkmate calculations.

      It could be improved by removing the need to iterate through the entire board every time by saving the king's location or saving it as a field that has a reference to the King object.

      Parameters:
      getWhite - , true if obtaining white king, false if obtaining black king.
      Returns:
      the desired King piece.

    • validMoveMade

      public boolean validMoveMade(int x, int y, Piece piece, boolean whitesTurn)
      This method returns a boolean which indicates if the move to the desired x/y coordinate is a legal move that the piece can made.

      It can be improved by simply checking if the x/y coordinate is within the selectedCoordinates field, although this would require changes in the Pawn classes' validMove() method as that method call sets state/move specific booleans that would thus no longer be updated.

      Parameters:
      x - any integer between 0-7 inclusive
      y - any integer between 0-7 inclusive
      piece - the Piece object that is to be moved
      whitesTurn - true if white is making the move, false if not
      Returns:
      true if the move is legal, false if not.
      See Also:
      • Pawn.validMove(int, int, Tile[][])

    • movePiece

      public void movePiece(int x, int y, Piece piece)
      This method updates the piece's coordinates to the new x/y coordinate and ensures that the old tiles piece field is set to null. Additionally, updateLocation() is called so that state specific fields are updated accordingly. If it moves onto a tile that already has a piece, it set's that piece's dead field to true so that the robot won't select that piece to be moved.
      Parameters:
      x - any integer between 0-7 inclusive.
      y - any integer between 0-7 inclusive.
      piece - the Piece object that is to be moved to x/y.
      See Also:
      • Pawn.updateLocation(int, int)
      • King.updateLocation(int, int)
      • Rook.updateLocation(int, int)

    • validCheckMove

      public boolean validCheckMove(int x, int y, Piece piece, boolean getWhite)
      This method is responsible for returning a piece (or null) that the player wants to move.

      This method implementation can be greatly improved by making changes in the Piece subclasses via a revised setLocation() method which simply changes the x/y field of the piece due to updateLocation() changes state specific variables that thus must be saved and restored whenever this method gets called.

      Parameters:
      x - any integer between 0-7 inclusive
      y - any integer between 0-7 inclusive
      piece - the Piece object that is to be moved to x/y
      getWhite - , true if obtaining white king, false if obtaining black king.
      Returns:
      true if the movement does not put/have the king in check, false if it does.
      See Also:
      • Pawn.updateLocation(int, int)
      • King.updateLocation(int, int)
      • Rook.updateLocation(int, int)

    • determineKingCheckStatus

      public boolean determineKingCheckStatus(boolean getWhite)
      The purpose of this method is to determine if a king is now in check or not. It is called within updateBoard(). The player's color is passed so that only the desired player's king is analyzed. [made public for robot]
      Parameters:
      getWhite - , true if player is white, false if not
      Returns:
      true if the king is in check, false if not.

    • selectPiece

      public Piece selectPiece(int x, int y, boolean playerIsWhite)
      This method is responsible for returning a piece (or null) that the player wants to move.
      Parameters:
      x - any integer between 0-7 inclusive.
      y - any integer between 0-7 inclusive.
      isWhite - , true if player is white, false if not
      Returns:
      a piece object if the piece can be selected by the player, null if empty/opponents piece.

    • removePiece

      public void removePiece(int xCoord, int yCoord)
      This simply updates the Tile[][] array so that the piece field is null.
      Parameters:
      xCoord - any integer between 0-7 inclusive.
      yCoord - any integer between 0-7 inclusive.

    • updateBoard

      public int updateBoard(int xCoord, int yCoord, Piece selectedPiece)
      This method is responsible for updating the board accordingly after a valid move has been made. It returns a boolean which indicates if the game is over or not, and if so, who won.
      Parameters:
      xCoord - any integer between 0-7 inclusive.
      yCoord - any integer between 0-7 inclusive.
      selectedPiece - the piece that is to be moved to xCoord, yCoord.
      Returns:
      an integer, 0 if checkmate not met, 1 if white won, and 2 if black won.

    • checkEnPassantMoveMade

      private void checkEnPassantMoveMade(Piece selectedPiece)
      This method checks if the en passant move has been made so that the board may be updated accordingly.
      Parameters:
      selectedPiece - the piece that has been moved.

    • checkCastleMoveMade

      private void checkCastleMoveMade(Piece piece)
      This method determines if the Piece object moved has castled and updates the board accordingly if it did.
      Parameters:
      piece - the piece that has been moved.

    • determineCheckMate

      public int determineCheckMate(Piece movedPiece)
      This method determines if the game is over. Additionally, it returns an int which indicates which player (if any) has won. [made public for robot]
      Parameters:
      movedPiece - , the piece that was moved this turn. Used to determine next player's color.
      Returns:
      an integer, 0 if checkmate not met, 1 if white won, and 2 if black won.

    • checkPromotion

      private void checkPromotion(Piece selectedPiece)
      This method promotes the pawn if it is on the opposite side of the board. It opens a display that allows the user to choose between a Queen, Knight, Bishop, or Rook, and updates the board accordingly with their selection.
      Parameters:
      selectedPiece - the Piece object that has been moved.

    • highlightCoordinates

      public void highlightCoordinates(Piece selectedPiece)
      This method highlights the possible moves that a piece may be moved onto and saves them to the selectedCoordinates field.
      Parameters:
      selectedPiece - the Piece object that may be moved by the player.

    • filterCheckMoves

      private void filterCheckMoves(Piece piece, List<Coordinate> coordinates)
      This method filters non-valid check related moves from a list of coordinates that a piece could potentially move to. It does so by calling validCheckMove(int, int, Piece, boolean) and is called in the highlightCoordinates(Piece) method.

      Currently it only filters the selectedCoordinates List, however it could easily be repurposed to filter all generateMove() methods.

      Parameters:
      piece - the Piece object that is to be moved.
      coordinates - a List of Coordinate objects that represent possible moves piece can move to.

    • unhighlightCoordinates

      public void unhighlightCoordinates()
      Un-highlights possible moves by setting selectedCoordinates to null.

    • getTile

      public Tile getTile(int x, int y)
      Returns tile at row y, column x.
      Parameters:
      x - any integer between 0 and 7 inclusive.
      y - any integer between 0 and 7 inclusive.
      Returns:
      a Tile object at the desired location.

    • getPromotion

      public boolean getPromotion()
      This method is used to determine if promotion has occurred on the board. It is used so that an opponent is not able to pick the enemies piece. If a player is playing with a robot however, they are able to choose what piece the robot gets.
      Returns:
      true if promotion has occurred, false if not.

    • printBoard

      public void printBoard()
      This is a debug method used to print the current state of the board in text form, although it can be improved via better formatting.
